comments:
I got a null pointer exception opening a Java Perspective. This happened after 
a GPF that kicked me out of Eclipse - there was also a CoreException so I 
suspect this was the root of the problem.

*** Bug 6477 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

FYI
I was able to reproduce the problem with some reliabilty by just killing 
Eclipse and restarting.
Note also that in bug 6477, I attached a small workspace that shows the problem.

The problem has been fixed.  Reproducible test case was:

1) Start a new workbench, open java perspective
2) Create a java project, and a file
3) Define a classpath variable
4) Kill the workbench VM
5) Restart... error occurs.

The error occurred because the code that restored snapshots was not restoring 
the root element's data.  This caused the IWorkspaceRoot to have null info, 
which can cause a NullPointerException in a number of places.

In the cases provided by Tod and Jerome, this was triggered by an attempt to 
access a persistent property stored with the root info.  The JDT stores 
classpath variables as session properties on the root, which caused an error 
when the JDT restarted and the root info was null.

DJ is adding session tests that reproduce the bug.
*** Bug 6003 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
